data.text:
Get better with every call. I know you are wondering why I started with this statement. This is one statement I have learnt from my Boss. As a customer service representative, there are some customers you come across and they get you overwhelmed. They leave you so shocked that by the end of that day, you become so angry.😂 My boss would always say "GET BETTER WITH EVERY CALL" And truly have gotten so better with every call and there's nothing a customer say's that pisses me off. 😂 I will always have something nice to say that calms you down. As a customer service representative, Do you think you've gotten better with calls? Seeing me for the first time? I am Ogbu Chidinma Perpetua an administrative assistant and customer service representative. I help you streamline administrative processes while maximizing result. #administrativeassistant #adminsupport #customersupport #customerservicerepresentative #Branding #innovations

There's an opening for a full-time Customer Service Position at my client's company. (form link below) 👉 Read this before applying... 📌 Before I go into the details, let me clarify a few things first: 📌 I'm just a middleman, that means you don't need to pitch me. I'll only forward your name to the client IF I think you'd fit right in. 📌 You MUST fill out the form properly and answer questions honestly. 📌 I WON'T entertain people in DMs, please. If you still do, that will only tell me you didn't read the instructions and that's a BIG red flag 📌 I WILL NOT vouch for you because I haven't worked with you (or those whom you'd recommend this job to) before. 📌 I DON'T know about the pay scale. But, I'm willing to give you some "insights" if I really think you can bring good value to the team. 👉 About the Company... So my client is a Spiritual Life Coach based in Canada. They provide Spiritual Life Coaching Certification and hold webinars and programs on Islamic Development-related topics. 👉 Okay let's go over the details real quick: So, in a nutshell, here are the details: - Email, Chat, FB Group, and Zoom support for students/audiences and some operational-level tasks - Software training will be given - 35 hours/week - Fluency in written and verbal English (a must-have) - Able to work with systems once trained - Someone who can be relied upon and has attention to detail - Someone who's pleasant to talk to cuz they'll be dealing with students and audience on emotional and sensitive topics 👉 What will happen when you fill out the form? (ACCEPTED) I'll reach out to people who I think could be a good fit for the company and also send their details to them. (REJECTED) I'll inform you when the position's been filled. 👉 Remember, it's not ALWAYS about the client, it's about YOU too (so don't hold back from justifying your worth) Click here to apply: https://lnkd.in/dEkfdWpZ So, if you know anyone, send them this email. P.S. Watched a movie this weekend about copywriting, will share my thoughts on it soon.

Hiring a Virtual Assistant guarantees this! Read on at www.circuit-assist.co.uk to find out how this life is possible by hiring a VA and taking the burden of back office responsibility off yourself. Rachel.va@circuit-assist.co.uk

I've been getting many calls from the press this week asking for my opinion on the Robert DeNiro lawsuit with his personal assistant. My comment has been the same for the past 16 years of being an agent: If you are going to hire a personal assistant, there should be a detailed job description. All the cards should be laid on the table. No stone should be left unturned when it comes to discussing duties. If, by chance, things come up that are not part of the job scope, then talk about it. It's called "personal" assistant for a reason. The job is night-and-day different than an executive assistant who works in a corporate office, so just know that. Thumbs up👍if you think it's a good idea to have a detailed job description. 'nuff said.
